polls.models module

class polls.models.Choice(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

This class defines the choice object which will correspond to each question

Parameters:

  • question (str) – This uses the models module to correspond the question to its possible choice

  • choice_text (CharField) – This stores the text of the different choices.

  • votes (IntegerField) – This variable stores the number of votes on each choice, and defaults to 0 when creating a new choice.

  • id (BigAutoField) – Primary key: ID

  • choice_text – Choice text

  • votes – Votes

Relationship fields:

Parameters:

question (ForeignKey to Question) – Question (related name: choice)

class polls.models.Question(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

This class defines the question object, which the superuser can create from the admin page.

Parameters:

  • question_text (CharField) – This simply stores the actual question.

  • pub_date (DateTimeField) – This stores the date that the question was published on the site.

  • id (BigAutoField) – Primary key: ID

  • question_text – Question text

  • pub_date – Date published

Reverse relationships:

Parameters:

choice (Reverse ForeignKey from Choice) – All choices of this question (related name of question)

exception DoesNotExist

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

choice_set

Type: Reverse ForeignKey from Choice

All choices of this question (related name of question)

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager

get_next_by_pub_date(*, field=<django.db.models.DateTimeField: pub_date>, is_next=True, **kwargs)

Finds next instance based on pub_date. See get_next_by_FOO() for more information.

polls.views module

polls.views.detail(request, question_id)[source]

This function will display a specific poll to the user, after they have logged in.

Parameters:

question (str) – This is a variable storing the question which the user selected.

polls.views.index(request)[source]

This function will display the different polls to the user, after they have logged in.

Parameters:

  • latest_question_list (list) – This orders, in a list, the polls by the date that they were published

  • context (dictionary) – This creates a dictionary, with the corresponding text and poll.

polls.views.results(request, question_id)[source]

This function will display the selected poll to the user and the results after they have voted on the poll, after they have logged in.

Parameters:

question (str) – This is a variable storing the question which the user selected.

polls.views.vote(request, question_id)[source]

This function will allow the user to vote on a specific poll, after they have logged in. This function also stores the result of the user’s vote to display later.

Parameters:

  • question (str) – This is a variable storing the question which the user selected.

  • selected_choice – This variable stores the users choice on the vote. If the user did not select a choice then an error message will appear, and they will be prompted to vote again.

  • selected_choice.votes (int) – This is a tally variable. It stores the number of votes that are on each choice of a poll question. After a tally has been added to this variable the state is stored.
